00019 /* Could calculate scale divisors at run time.  2^(1/2) is approx
00020    1.0594631.  A reasonable rational approximation is 267/252 =
00021    1.0595238.  Let's save memory and provide a macro to compute the
00022    divisors.  */
00023 
00024 #define TWEETER_DIVISOR(POLL_RATE, FREQ) (POLL_RATE / FREQ + 0.5)
00025 
00026 
00027 enum {TWEETER_NOTE_MIN = 40};
00028 /* Define divisors for chromatic scale E2 -> D#3.  For better accuracy
00029    this should be defined for the lowest frequency scale, however,
00030    this may need 16 bits per note.  */
00031 #define TWEETER_SCALE_TABLE(POLL_RATE) \
00032    {TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 82.41), \
00033     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 87.31), \
00034     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 92.50), \
00035     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 98.00), \
00036     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 103.83), \
00037     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 110.0), \
00038     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 116.54), \
00039     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 123.47), \
00040     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 130.81), \
00041     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 138.59), \
00042     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 146.83), \
00043     TWEETER_DIVISOR (POLL_RATE, 155.56)}

00060 /* The scale table is usually defined with:
00061 
00062  static tweeter_scale_t scale_table[] = TWEETER_SCALE_TABLE (LOOP_POLL_RATE);
00063 */
00064 
00065 extern int8_t 
00066 tweeter_update (tweeter_t tweeter);
00067 
00068 /* The note and velocity are specified as per the MIDI standard except
00069    a note value of 0 indicates a rest (note off).  The velocity has a
00070    maximum value of 127 and gives an indication of the note
00071    volume.  */
00072 extern void
00073 tweeter_note_play (tweeter_t tweeter, tweeter_note_t note, uint8_t velocity);
00074

00077               uint16_t poll_rate,
00078               tweeter_scale_t *scale_table);
